trans-unit.source: How to: Create a REST-based Service that Accesses Service Bus
trans-unit.target: How to: Create a REST-based Service that Accesses Service Bus

trans-unit.source: <token>sb2</token> currently supports applications that qualify as REST-based services: a traditional <token>sb2</token> application that complies with the Web programming model.
trans-unit.target: <token>sb2</token> currently supports applications that qualify as REST-based services: a traditional <token>sb2</token> application that complies with the Web programming model.

trans-unit.source: This style of application uses the basic <token>indigo1</token> programming model: defining and creating a service contract, using a binding and security credentials to connect to <token>sb2</token>, and so on.
trans-unit.target: This style of application uses the basic <token>indigo1</token> programming model: defining and creating a service contract, using a binding and security credentials to connect to <token>sb2</token>, and so on.

trans-unit.source: The main addition is that a REST-based <token>sb2</token> application uses a service contract to whose members the <codeInline>[OperationContract, WebGet]</codeInline> or <codeInline>[OperationContract, WebInvoke]</codeInline> attributes are applied.
trans-unit.target: The main addition is that a REST-based <token>sb2</token> application uses a service contract to whose members the <codeInline>[OperationContract, WebGet]</codeInline> or <codeInline>[OperationContract, WebInvoke]</codeInline> attributes are applied.

trans-unit.source: These behaviors define the interface as a REST interface, and allow <token>sb2</token> to interact with other REST-style applications.
trans-unit.target: These behaviors define the interface as a REST interface, and allow <token>sb2</token> to interact with other REST-style applications.

trans-unit.source: As such, the applications contain additional code that enables them to build HTTP-style messages.
trans-unit.target: As such, the applications contain additional code that enables them to build HTTP-style messages.

trans-unit.source: Finally, all these applications use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding.
trans-unit.target: Finally, all these applications use the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="9016f395-ae26-496f-a433-c3ef29eeb326" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design a REST-ful AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <link xlink:href="9016f395-ae26-496f-a433-c3ef29eeb326" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design a REST-ful AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.

trans-unit.source: For an example of a REST-based service application, see the <link xlink:href="286326f9-883b-4191-a7df-f107f3cbc26a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">REST Tutorial for the AppFabric Service Bus</link>, which is in turn based on the <externalLink><linkText>WebHttp</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Relayed-Messaging-Bindings-a6477ba0</linkUri></externalLink> <token>sb2</token> sample.
trans-unit.target: For an example of a REST-based service application, see the <link xlink:href="286326f9-883b-4191-a7df-f107f3cbc26a" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">REST Tutorial for the AppFabric Service Bus</link>, which is in turn based on the <externalLink><linkText>WebHttp</linkText><linkUri>http://code.msdn.microsoft.com/Relayed-Messaging-Bindings-a6477ba0</linkUri></externalLink> <token>sb2</token> sample.

trans-unit.source: The process of hosting a REST-based <token>sb2</token> application is very similar to hosting a standard <token>sb2</token> application.
trans-unit.target: The process of hosting a REST-based <token>sb2</token> application is very similar to hosting a standard <token>sb2</token> application.

trans-unit.source: The main differences are in the contract and configuration: the actual hosting process is basically the same.
trans-unit.target: The main differences are in the contract and configuration: the actual hosting process is basically the same.

trans-unit.source: To host a Service Bus service application that complies with the REST standard
trans-unit.target: To host a Service Bus service application that complies with the REST standard

trans-unit.source: Create the service by using the standard pattern as defined in <link xlink:href="5f8947bc-26c6-4b15-a3a4-74bd3a0edb58" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Hosting an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>; that is, define and implement a service contract, configure and implement the service host, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Create the service by using the standard pattern as defined in <link xlink:href="5f8947bc-26c6-4b15-a3a4-74bd3a0edb58" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Hosting an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>; that is, define and implement a service contract, configure and implement the service host, and so on.

trans-unit.source: When applying the <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute</codeEntityReference> attribute to the service contract, make sure that you apply the relevant attributes to identify the REST-based members.
trans-unit.target: When applying the <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.OperationContractAttribute</codeEntityReference> attribute to the service contract, make sure that you apply the relevant attributes to identify the REST-based members.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> How to: <link xlink:href="9016f395-ae26-496f-a433-c3ef29eeb326" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design a REST-ful AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> How to: <link xlink:href="9016f395-ae26-496f-a433-c3ef29eeb326" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">How to: Design a REST-ful AppFabric Service Bus Contract</link>.

trans-unit.source: The following example code shows how to tag an interface member as a REST-style GET member.
trans-unit.target: The following example code shows how to tag an interface member as a REST-style GET member.

trans-unit.source: When implementing the contract, set the appropriate content type header for the outgoing Web responses, as defined by the needs of your application.
trans-unit.target: When implementing the contract, set the appropriate content type header for the outgoing Web responses, as defined by the needs of your application.

trans-unit.source: Create the address for the service by using the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.CreateServiceUri(System.String,System.String,System.String)</codeEntityReference> method:
trans-unit.target: Create the address for the service by using the <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="false">M:Microsoft.ServiceBus.ServiceBusEnvironment.CreateServiceUri(System.String,System.String,System.String)</codeEntityReference> method:

trans-unit.source: Create a new instance of <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebServiceHost</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: Create a new instance of <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebServiceHost</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebServiceHost</codeEntityReference> class is derived from the <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost</codeEntityReference> class, and complements the <token>indigo2</token> Web programming model.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebServiceHost</codeEntityReference> class is derived from the <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost</codeEntityReference> class, and complements the <token>indigo2</token> Web programming model.

trans-unit.source: It also makes it easier to host REST-based services.
trans-unit.target: It also makes it easier to host REST-based services.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you use <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebServiceHost</codeEntityReference> instead of <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost</codeEntityReference> in your REST-based <token>sb2</token> application implementation.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you use <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Web.WebServiceHost</codeEntityReference> instead of <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.ServiceHost</codeEntityReference> in your REST-based <token>sb2</token> application implementation.

trans-unit.source: <token>crdefault</token> <embeddedLabel>WCF REST Programming Model</embeddedLabel> in the <token>indigo2</token> documentation.
trans-unit.target: <token>crdefault</token> <embeddedLabel>WCF REST Programming Model</embeddedLabel> in the <token>indigo2</token> documentation.

trans-unit.source: Specify the address, binding, and contracts (also known as the "ABCs") used by the service endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Specify the address, binding, and contracts (also known as the "ABCs") used by the service endpoint.

trans-unit.source: Here, the ABC is linked to the endpoint in the App.config file.
trans-unit.target: Here, the ABC is linked to the endpoint in the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> configuring an application, see <link xlink:href="c3c38827-e436-4e31-8ea6-3d90e6d169d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> configuring an application, see <link xlink:href="c3c38827-e436-4e31-8ea6-3d90e6d169d4" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Configuring an AppFabric Service Bus Application</link>.

trans-unit.source: The only binding to use for a service endpoint in a REST-based <token>sb2</token> application is <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: The only binding to use for a service endpoint in a REST-based <token>sb2</token> application is <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: If necessary, disable client authentication.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, disable client authentication.

trans-unit.source: By default, the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding requires client authentication.
trans-unit.target: By default, the <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.WebHttpRelayBinding</codeEntityReference> binding requires client authentication.

trans-unit.source: This step describes how to disable it in the <codeInline>%%amp;lt;binding%%amp;gt;</codeInline> element in the App.config file, so that the client does not have to present credentials (for example, when you use a browser).
trans-unit.target: This step describes how to disable it in the <codeInline>%%amp;lt;binding%%amp;gt;</codeInline> element in the App.config file, so that the client does not have to present credentials (for example, when you use a browser).

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> authenticating with the <token>sb2</token>, see <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> authenticating with the <token>sb2</token>, see <link xlink:href="defd9147-3244-49e5-8304-09dc8ad9bac5" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Securing and Authenticating an AppFabric Service Bus Connection</link>.

trans-unit.target: Define the security for your application:

trans-unit.target: In this example, the security is defined in the App.config file.

trans-unit.source: Open the service with a call to <codeInline>WebServiceHost.Open</codeInline>:
trans-unit.target: Open the service with a call to <codeInline>WebServiceHost.Open</codeInline>:

trans-unit.source: When you are finished, close the host with <codeInline>WebServiceHost.Close</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: When you are finished, close the host with <codeInline>WebServiceHost.Close</codeInline>.
